topic.title: Spirituality, Philosophy, Religion
topic.body:
What kind of spiritual, philosophical or religious writers do you guys read?
I've been getting into Franklin Merrell-Wolff lately. It's a lot like Buddhism but more accessible for philosophically inclined westerners.
If you guys want I can share the archive of his writings I uploaded to ZeroUP.

1581933903_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body:
I agree. Gaming these days is just another distraction for the cattle to fall for.
Any intelligent white person should avoid wasting his or her time (usually his!) with such garbage.
The muslims tell followers of their religion not to waste time on distractions that are of no benefit.
Muhammad himself forbid things like "ideal talk", and what are video games if not just as useless?

Video games are just another Zionist distraction, and Lord knows nothing good will ever come of them...

1583235865_1MTiDbYKVBHvcZRH4AikT2PbpUGBT.body:
This world is coming to an end. 
We are living out the last days of the Kali Yuga. 
All things the vedas told of have come to be. 
Take solace in the knowledge that all this has happened before and it will happen again.

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_1887_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): "Covid-19 is nature's response to the human race exploiting earth" = religious thinking [...]

In the same way that a car doesn't literally want to get to it's destination or a computer doesn't literally want to run an application, Nature doesn't literally want to kill off humans with the coronavirus.
The fact that Nature evolves viruses like this one is enough. 
Wether or Nature is "intelligent" or has "free" "will" is irrelevant and only seems relevant from within a human-centric worldview.

1583203227_12tcdM86TcZQeHEsSea3kTdTiExBK.body: You're on Zeronet but you think decentralisation is bad?

1583512099_17ThiaUZmUKD2nEKkvUN6iCvaa1F3.body:
I made a channel for rare videos of American philosopher-mystic Franklin Merrell-Wolff.
He had lots of Buddhism style ideas. Arriving at them independently, he still help popularise them in America at a time when most americans hadn't heard of them.
He does this all while still remaining intellectually rigorous and without falling into stupid new age nonsense.

You can check it out here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:channel+id:15f1_14zchTWnWYvtEDLN6Wj2z7KvG95op7Yw48
